prop.caption: Name
prop.description: the name of the application, used by many different services to uniquely identify the application.

prop.caption: Debug
prop.description: whether the debug screen is shown at startup.

prop.caption: disable-right-click
prop.description: whether a user can get the browsers contextmenu when the right mouse button is clicked.

prop.caption: allow-select
prop.description: whether general text in the application can be selected.

prop.caption: allow-blur
prop.description: whether it's possible to blur an element while not giving the focus to another element. Defaults to true.

prop.caption: auto-disable-actions
prop.description: whether smartbinding actions are by default disabled.

prop.caption: auto-disable
prop.description: whether elements that don't have content loaded are automatically disabled.

prop.caption: disable-f5
prop.description: whether the F5 key for refreshing is disabled.

prop.caption: auto-hide-loading
prop.description: whether the load screen defined by the loader element is automatically hidden. Setting this to false enables you to control when the loading screen is hidden. Use the following code to do so:

prop.caption: disable-space
prop.description: whether the space button default behaviour of scrolling the page is disabled.

prop.caption: disable-backspace
prop.description: whether the backspace button default behaviour of going to the previous history state is disabled.

prop.caption: default-page
prop.description: the name of the default page if none is specified using the #. Defaults to 'home'. See {object.history}.

prop.caption: undokeys
prop.description: whether the undo and redo keys (in windows they are ctrl-Z and ctrl-Y) are enabled.

prop.caption: outline
prop.description: whether an outline of an element is shown while dragging or resizing.

prop.caption: drag-outline
prop.description: whether an outline of an element is shown while dragging.

prop.caption: resize-outline
prop.description: whether an outline of an element is shown while resizing.

prop.caption: baseurl
prop.description: the basepath for any relative url used throughout your application. This included teleport definitions and {@link term.datainstruction data instruction}.

prop.caption: loading-message
prop.description: the global value for the loading message of elements during a loading state.

prop.caption: offline-message
prop.description: the global value for the offline message of elements not able to display content while offline.

prop.caption: empty-message
prop.description: the global value for the empty message of elements containing no contents.

prop.caption: model
prop.description: the default model for this application.

prop.caption: realtime
prop.description: the global value whether bound values are realtime updated. When set to false elements do not update until they lose focus.

prop.caption: skinset
prop.description: the skin set used by the application.

prop.caption: layout
prop.description: the {@link term.datainstruction data instruction} to retrieve the layout xml definition.

prop.caption: storage
prop.description: the {@link core.storage storage provider} to be used for key/value storage.

prop.caption: offline
prop.description: the {@link core.storage storage provider} to be used for offline support.

prop.caption: login
prop.description: the {@link term.datainstruction data instruction} which logs a user into the application.

prop.caption: logout
prop.description: the {@link term.datainstruction data instruction} which logs a user out of the application.

prop.caption: iepngfix
prop.description: whether the fix for PNG images with transparency should be applied. Default is false.

prop.caption: iepngfix-elements
prop.description: a comma-seperated list of CSS identifiers (classes) to which the transparent-PNG fix will be applied.

prop.caption: iphone-fullscreen
prop.description: whether the application should cover the entire screen of the iPhone. Default is true.

prop.caption: iphone-statusbar
prop.description: the style of the statusbar of the iPhone webbrowser. Posssible values: 'default', black-translucent' or 'black'.

prop.caption: iphone-icon
prop.description: path pointing to the icon that should be used when this application is put on the iPhone Dashboard.

prop.caption: iphone-icon-is-glossy
prop.description: whether the icon specified with 'iphone-icon' already is glossy or if the iPhone OS should apply that effect. Default is false.

prop.caption: iphone-fixed-viewport
prop.description: whether the viewport of the application is fixed and whether the zoom should be enabled. Default is true.

prop.caption: propertychange
prop.description: Fires when a property changes.
